paper.title: Apply algebraic methods in solving problems

parts.text: Solve the equation: 4(2x - 3) + 5x = 27.
Solve the inequality: 3x + 7 > 22.
The line y = 2x - 4 intersects the x-axis at point A. Find the coordinates of A.
Factorise: x² + 7x + 12 = 0.
Solve using the quadratic formula: 3x² - 2x - 2 = 0.
The discriminant of ax² + bx + c = 0 is 25. If a = 1 and b = -6, find c.
Solve the system: 2x + y = 7, x - 3y = -8.
An arithmetic sequence has first term 5 and common difference 3. Find the 10th term.
The sum of the first n terms of a sequence is S_n = n² + n. Find the 4th term.
Sketch the graph of y = x² - 4x + 3, showing intercepts and vertex.
The graph of y = f(x) is transformed to y = 2f(x - 1) + 3. Describe the transformations.
parts.answer: Horizontal shift right 1 unit, vertical stretch by factor 2, vertical shift up 3 units

parts.text: Find the equation of the line parallel to y = 3x - 2 passing through (1, 5).
A rectangle has length (x + 4) cm and width (2x - 1) cm. The perimeter is 50 cm. Solve for x.
Diagram: Right-angled triangle with opposite side 5 cm to angle θ, hypotenuse 13 cm. Find sin θ.
Hence find the adjacent side.

paper.title: Investigate relationships between tables, equations and graphs

parts.text: Find the equation of a line passing through given points.
Write the equation after transforming y = -7/2 x - 3 with given shifts.

Three players (Anne, Ben, Charlie) have health points over time in a game. Anne: linear decrease from 4000, loses 500 per minute. Ben: exponential decay from 12000, halves each minute. Charlie: quadratic relationship starting at 12250, finishing at 7 minutes. Find equations, create table and graphs, and make comments about the game.
parts.answer: Anne: y = 4000 - 500x, Ben: y = 12000(1/2)^x, Charlie: y = -250x² + 12250. Key comment: Charlie finishes first.

parts.text: Draw the graph of an exponential function y = 2^x showing accuracy through points (-1, 2), (0, 4), (1, 8), (2, 16), (3, 32).
Find the x-coordinate of the vertex and the depth (y-value) of a parabola representing a hole.
Make two valid comments about how to make the hole less deep by changing the quadratic equation.
parts.answer: e.g., Reducing the coefficient of 0.8 will make the hole less deep.

parts.text: Find the equation of an exponential curve shown in a graph.
A hole has equation related to y = 0.125(x - 5)² - 2.5. Water surface is at y = -2. Find the width of the hole at water level.
Find the equation of a parabola with given properties (vertex or factored form).
Find T values when n = 4 and n = 5 from a pattern sequence.
Find the formula for the sequence pattern.
Draw a graph of the sequence for 1 ≤ n ≤ 8 showing discrete values only.
parts.answer: Graph with discrete points, not a continuous line.

parts.text: Lizzy has a 60 cm stick to cut into two pieces to form a rectangle. Investigate the relationship between lengths and area. Create table, graph, and equation, and make comments about maximum area and patterns.
parts.answer: Area = x(60 - x). Maximum area = 900 cm² when both lengths are 30 cm.

paper.title: Apply geometric reasoning in solving problems

questions.topic: Angles, parallel lines, trigonometry and similar triangles

parts.text: Find the value of x (angle AGB), given that angle AED = 58° in a triangle, and lines are parallel.
Calculate the area of triangle AHE, where the base is 4 m and angle is 46°. Use EK = 2.8 × tan 46°.

Two similar triangular sails P and Q have bases 3.6 m and 1.44 m respectively. Triangle P has side length 6 m. Calculate total sail area and determine if sails are big enough for top speed (need 12 m²).
parts.answer: Total sail area = 11.95 m². Sails are not big enough.

parts.text: Navigation problem: Find bearing from M to S using triangle with sides 448 km (angle 36°) and 635 km (angle 66°).
Show that h = 6.32 m using Pythagoras theorem, given hypotenuse 8 m and base 4.9 m.
Find length g = PQ, where MQ and MP are calculated using Pythagoras. Given MQ uses height 6.32 m and hypotenuse 11 m.
Find the perimeter of a shape involving triangle MPN with angle 52.2° and side 4.9 m.
Prove that ∠SAG = ∠AHG = ∠GBA = p using circle theorems (tangent-radius, angle in semicircle, angles in same segment).
Find angle q = ∠VRS using circle theorems. Given ∠VRU base angle is 71° and ∠URT = 38°.

questions.topic: Angle properties, tangent-radius, cyclic quadrilaterals and regular polygons

parts.text: Find ∠MEB given that ∠EBM = 58° (alternate angles, parallel lines) and triangle is isosceles.
Find length LC where ∠CML = 90° (tangent-radius), ∠MLN is bisected giving ∠MLCe = 36°, and CL is opposite the 36° angle with adjacent side 28 mm.
Find ∠DBA in terms of x, where ∠DAB = x, using angle in semicircle and cyclic quadrilateral properties.
Find expression for total area of regular octagon with vertices on circle radius r, where internal angle is 135°.
